alexmaru - (22/04/2009 10:31): hi sdumitriu  
sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 10:32): Hi  
alexmaru - (22/04/2009 10:33): you talked about test-driven development  
alexmaru - (22/04/2009 10:33): how can I develop the widget using test-driven development?  
sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 10:34): If it's on Web, Selenium is a good option  
alexmaru - (22/04/2009 10:34): ok  
sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 10:34): Or, you can use jsunit to test the JS code  
alexmaru - (22/04/2009 10:34): or both  
sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 10:34): There are 2 jsunit projects, and each one has a corresponding maven plugin  
sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 10:35): Yes, ideally you should use both frameworks  
JiBz is now known as Cathia (i=c3655135@gateway/web/ajax/mibbit.com/x-d23c6700005f7ee5)  
alexmaru - (22/04/2009 10:35): I thought my project is independent of XWiki  
sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 10:36): WDYM?  
alexmaru - (22/04/2009 10:36): and using only the API  
alexmaru - (22/04/2009 10:36): why does jsunit has to be a maven plugin?  
Cathia is now known as JiBz (i=c3655135@gateway/web/ajax/mibbit.com/x-d23c6700005f7ee5)  
sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 10:36): Maven is not tied to XWiki  
sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 10:37): It is the best (IMO) project management tool  
sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 10:37): And since it has support for JS, it is a good choice to use it  
ancutagheorghe - (22/04/2009 10:37): hi sdumitriu .. about the mail on the devs list .. as you probably already read i want to work on the project i applied for,  should i expect an approval to do this? :)  
sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 10:38): ancutagheorghe: Yes  
sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 10:38): I'll answer the mails a bit later today  
ancutagheorghe - (22/04/2009 10:38): OK :)  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 10:39  
alexmaru - (22/04/2009 10:39): using maven to develop a widget? isn't maven good for big projects?  
sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 10:39): No, maven is good for anything  
sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 10:39): We use it for our tiny components  
sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 10:40): Like, 5 java classes  
alexmaru - (22/04/2009 10:40): okay! I'll catch up with this subject  
sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 10:41): After Anamaria's project starts working, it will be easy to test the widget, since XWiki will be both a valid container AND the data source for the widget  
alexmaru - (22/04/2009 10:44): ok, interesting  
alexmaru - (22/04/2009 10:46): but I don't understand why it will be easier for me to test?  
sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 10:47): Well, how do you test something for iGoogle?  
sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 10:48): You need to put the widget on iGoogle and work remotely with it  
alexmaru - (22/04/2009 10:48): yes  
alexmaru - (22/04/2009 10:48): that's not such a big problem, I think :)  
JiBz left at 10:49 ("http://www.mibbit.com ajax IRC Client")  
JiBz joined #xwiki at 10:49  
lucien joined #xwiki at 10:50  
anamariastoica joined #xwiki at 10:52  
alexmaru - (22/04/2009 10:54): ok, thanks for the info, it's nice to collaborate with u again  
alexmaru - (22/04/2009 10:55): u said it's better to fix some issues first, roght?  
glerouge joined #xwiki at 10:57  
alexmaru - (22/04/2009 10:58): hi glerouge  
glerouge - (22/04/2009 10:58): hi alexmaru  
alexmaru - (22/04/2009 10:59): I was talking with sergiu about how to develop the widget  
glerouge - (22/04/2009 10:59): yep  
alexmaru - (22/04/2009 10:59): I'm gonna use too test driven development, and sergiu said that it's good to use maven for my project

sdumitriu1 joined #xwiki at 11:04  
sdumitriu1 - (22/04/2009 11:04): alexmaru: Yes, fixing some issues is good  
glerouge - (22/04/2009 11:06): sdumitriu1 alexmaru -> how many projects are needed? one per widget platform? one for all the code?  
sdumitriu1 - (22/04/2009 11:06): I don't know  
cregep joined #xwiki at 11:06  
sdumitriu1 - (22/04/2009 11:06): With maven we could have just one project, with several profiles  
cristinaS joined #xwiki at 11:09  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 11:13  
JiBz - (22/04/2009 11:14): How to get the current space name in Velocity script plz ???  
JiBz - (22/04/2009 11:16): Fixed: $doc.getSpace()   
JiBz - (22/04/2009 11:16): 5^^

sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 14:27): arunreddy: Do you want a small javascript issue?  
jvelociter - (22/04/2009 14:43): ancutagheorghe: Hi  
tharindu left at 14:43 ("Leaving")  
jvelociter - (22/04/2009 14:44): I've read your mail where you say you still want to contribute on anti-vandalism filters as your time allows it. For XWiki 1.9 I'm going to implement XE-431(Make captcha activable for register and comment actions from the XWiki adminstration UI). Do you want to help me doing this ?  
vmassol - (22/04/2009 14:48): jvelociter: no need to copy the issue's title we have our bot working for this now ;)  
jvelociter - (22/04/2009 14:48): yup  
ChathuraPrabuddh joined #xwiki at 14:56  
ancutagheorghe - (22/04/2009 15:12): Hi jvelociter  
ancutagheorghe - (22/04/2009 15:12): sorry wasn't around  
ancutagheorghe - (22/04/2009 15:12): let me see  
ancutagheorghe - (22/04/2009 15:13): jvelociter, Sure !  
jvelociter - (22/04/2009 15:14): ancutagheorghe: cool !  
jvelociter - (22/04/2009 15:15): the step after that is going to be moving to jcaptcha 2.0   
jvelociter - (22/04/2009 15:15): they have more comprehensive captchas  
ancutagheorghe - (22/04/2009 15:15): why not directly 2.0?  
jvelociter - (22/04/2009 15:15): the ones in 1.0 are difficult even for humans :)  
sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 15:16): Or this:   
sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 15:16): http://code.google.com/p/kaptcha/  
jvelociter - (22/04/2009 15:16): because I'm not sure we will have time for during 1.9 and it's not yet officially released  
ancutagheorghe - (22/04/2009 15:16): i will have to do some reading about this first .. to actually know what i have to do :))  
jvelociter - (22/04/2009 15:16): yep  
ancutagheorghe - (22/04/2009 15:17): if you already have some interesting links, please share them :)  
jvelociter - (22/04/2009 15:17): sdumitriu yes kaptcha :) vmassol is doing some lobbying so we stick on jcaptcha ;)  
jvelociter - (22/04/2009 15:17): ancutagheorghe: I have some links and some more info, but I have to look for it   
jvelociter - (22/04/2009 15:17): I'll come back with more soon  
sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 15:18): jvelociter: lobbying for what?  
jvelociter - (22/04/2009 15:18): for keeping jcaptcha  
ancutagheorghe - (22/04/2009 15:18): ok .. if i will not be online, please email them to me  
ancutagheorghe - (22/04/2009 15:18): [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
vmassol - (22/04/2009 15:18): jvelociter: :) I'm jsut saying that we should talk to MarcAntoine and we did and he released jcaptcha 2.0 for us. Now the question is: is it good for us now?  
jvelociter - (22/04/2009 15:18): it's done by Octo, Vincent's former company  
jvelociter - (22/04/2009 15:19): yes I have to talk to marc, because I could not find the struts integration any longer for 2.0  
vmassol - (22/04/2009 15:19): (marc antoine is a good friend so we can get support for jcaptcha easily, all I'm saying is that we talk to him if there's something missing in jcaptcha before deciding to use something else)  
jvelociter - (22/04/2009 15:19): yes  
vmassol - (22/04/2009 15:19): I'm not against moving to something else if we find jcaptcha not good enough for whatever reason  
sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 15:19): Well, I'm not proposing, I'm just listing alternatives  
jvelociter - (22/04/2009 15:19): but my point is that right now I'm going to make the current captcha we have activable from the UI  
vmassol - (22/04/2009 15:19): yes that's good  
jvelociter - (22/04/2009 15:19): it's already a step forward  
sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 15:19): Before we do anything, of course we need to evaluate all libraries  
lwilke joined #xwiki at 15:22  
marta\_ joined #xwiki at 15:23  
lwilke - (22/04/2009 15:26): hi, i am struggling with a new installation of xwiki 1.8.1 i installed the standalone war file and configured tomcat5.5 on a debian 5.0 vm. After configuring mysql i tried to access xwiki but i always get an exeception Exception while reading document XWiki.XWikiPreferences could not load an entity: [com.xpn.xwiki.doc.XWikiDocument#104408758]  
lwilke - (22/04/2009 15:26): mysql user and the db are setup and configured  
lwilke - (22/04/2009 15:27): but it seems xwiki does not create any schema at all!?  
sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 15:28): lwilke: Can you check the tomcat logs to see the full stack trace?  
sdumitriu - (22/04/2009 15:29): Then put it on http://xwiki.pastebin.com/

kraze - (22/04/2009 21:51): I'm trying to migrate from XWiki 0.9 to 1.8.1.  I found instructions at http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/UpgradeXWiki09Installation which details an Import/Expore procedure which I'm trying to use, but when I create the new page in my 0.9 wiki and copy/paste the code as instructed, I get an error "Error number 4001 in 4: Error while parsing velocity page XWiki.Migration Wrapped Exception: Encountered "#end" at line 393, column 1. Wa  
asyd - (22/04/2009 21:51): sdumitriu: can you telle me in few words differences between 1.8 and 1.9 ?  
kraze - (22/04/2009 21:52): s/Expore/Export/g  
sdumitriu1 joined #xwiki at 21:57  
sdumitriu1 - (22/04/2009 21:57): kraze: Where exactly is the code you are trying to use?  
kraze - (22/04/2009 21:58): http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation\_ExportImport09  
kraze - (22/04/2009 21:58): it says to login there, edit the page, copy/paste its code into my 0.9 wiki  
kraze - (22/04/2009 21:58): I get the error when I save or preview this code in my 0.9 wiki  
kraze - (22/04/2009 21:59): "Add the Export/Import utility to your v0.9 wiki (see also xwiki.js and prototype.js attachments to this page). To perform this action log-in to this site, choose to edit the page and copy/paste the code to a new page in your v0.9 XWiki"  
sdumitriu1 - (22/04/2009 21:59): asyd: several UI improvements

kraze - (22/04/2009 22:01): the comments listed on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/UpgradeXWiki09Installation express the issues I'm facing as well
